testCases.explanation: 2 maps to abc, 3 maps to def. All combinations of one letter from each group.
Empty string input returns empty list.
2 maps to abc. Single digit yields all its mapped letters.
7 maps to pqrs, 9 maps to wxyz. All 4x4=16 combinations.

description:
Given a string containing digits from 2-9 inclusive, return all possible letter combinations that the number could represent. Return the answer in any order.

A mapping of digits to letters (just like on a telephone keypad) is:
- 2: abc, 3: def, 4: ghi, 5: jkl, 6: mno, 7: pqrs, 8: tuv, 9: wxyz

See the full problem on [LeetCode 17](https://leetcode.com/problems/letter-combinations-of-a-phone-number/).
constraints: digits[i] is a digit in the range ['2', '9']
